item.title: Using numbers to find the greatest scorer in NBA history
item.description: Using numbers to find the greatest scorer in NBA history For the last couple of years, basketball fans have been trying to settle one of the biggest debates in the history of the game. Who is the greatest scorer in NBA history? Many people have used various methods to settle the debate, such as comparing career averages and comparing highlights from different players. Yes I have acutally see people do that on twitter and it has resulted in tweets such as.

item.title: Using Numbers to solve March Madness Seeding
item.description: Solving the Unpredictability of March Madness Seeding (potentially) College Basketball fans all around the country wait every year to take another swing at a perfect bracket. Despite many feeling confident they have the perfect one this year, after one day of games they wont be feeling that way anymore. Most people use seeding as one of the main way to fill out their bracket. Teams are seeded 1-16 and are seeded based on season performance by the NCAA selection committee.

item.title: About
item.description: When NCAA tournament time approaches every march, college basketball fans wait in anticipation for what teams are seeded higher and lower. However the higher seed teams still loose to lower seeded teams and massive upsets happen every year. This blog is dedicated to figuring out correct seeding for the NCAA tournament based on stats because people lie but numbers don’t. This blog was writen by Xander Chamberlin. He is a sophmore at UNL from Naperville Illinois majoring in Sports Media and Communications.
